channel.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
channel.description:
First off, I know this could be on several sections but I chose this one lol
Okay so I am TRYING to run SK on Ubuntu. I am aware already that there is no "linux plateform" for Ubuntu so you got to try what your able to right? :)
So let's get started...
I downloaded the dll file that was needed. I have java jre6/7 downloaded I have java web start downloaded.
Here is my debug.txt
[code][2/3/2012 2:36:41 PM] Starting up... [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Starting up...launcher version is 1.61.17 [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] App data folder path is C:\Program Files\SwiftKit\AppData [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Checking folder structure [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Attempt to set browser emulation [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Check if drive is NTFS [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Starting cleanup [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Variables set [2/3/2012 2:36:42 PM] Delete all temp files [2/3/2012 2:36:44 PM] Finished cleaning up temp data [2/3/2012 2:36:44 PM] Initialize finished [2/3/2012 2:36:45 PM] Launch button was pressed [2/3/2012 2:36:45 PM] Get a setting from somewhere [2/3/2012 2:36:45 PM] Connecting [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Update server responded, download update file [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Got our update file, now decode it [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Update file decoded, now read it... [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Check versions [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - SwiftKit(Install).exe [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - SwiftKit.exe [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - ExePatcher.exe [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - LaVolpeAlphaImg.ocx [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - SwiftKit-RS.exe [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - swiftirc.ocx [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - SwiftKitData001.skd [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - SwiftKitData002.skd [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - Help.chm [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - WorldInfo.ini [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - Tips.ini [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - Links.ini [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - swiftirc_text.xml [2/3/2012 2:36:46 PM] Checking file - rsmap [2/3/2012 2:36:48 PM] CRITICAL ERROR YO [2/3/2012 2:36:48 PM] 438 - Object doesn't support this property or method [2/3/2012 2:36:48 PM] Starting up... [2/3/2012 2:36:49 PM] Populate our profiles list[/code]
Okay now I did some research on this error supposedly this is an error specifically with visual basic from what I have read. It has to do with it not being an "automated" object. So my question is how can I make this be "automated"

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:22, topic:431648”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534354.msg4288884#msg4288884 date=1366861578]
I always ran the game through a loader, never banned.
[/quote]

It’s because Jagex hasn’t done a mass ban yet. They flag the accounts as soon as they log in but they just wait to do something with it until they’re ready.[/quote]
I guess they haven’t done a mass ban since around 2007.

mdog is correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:21, topic:431648”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=534354.msg4290179#msg4290179 date=1367083475]

tbh, all someone has to do is have a loader w/ a few utilities/irc client and bam, you’ve got swiftkit.

Jagex monitors where you login from whether it being a browser or an external client. I think it’s part of their bot detection or some crap which is most likely why swiftkit its based on a browser. If you’ve seen the loaders released by some members are unsafe because it still puts you at that risk of getting put under suspicion.

OT: Wine should fix your problem unless you’re doing something wrong.
[/quote]
I always ran the game through a loader, never banned.[/quote]
Same.

[quote=“Arcik, post:22, topic:431648”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534354.msg4288884#msg4288884 date=1366861578]
I always ran the game through a loader, never banned.
[/quote]

It’s because Jagex hasn’t done a mass ban yet. They flag the accounts as soon as they log in but they just wait to do something with it until they’re ready.[/quote]
Trust me, between T4 and myself we’ve lived through more mass bans than you knew existed.

Read full topic

Jagex monitors where you login from whether it being a browser or an external client. I think it’s part of their bot detection or some crap which is most likely why swiftkit its based on a browser. If you’ve seen the loaders released by some members are unsafe because it still puts you at that risk of getting put under suspicion.

OT: Wine should fix your problem unless you’re doing something wrong.[/quote]

You’re probably going to lose a lot of performance running Java on wine.
[/quote]ew why the hell would you use java with wine…[/quote]Exactly why I said that. Running SwiftKit on wine isn’t worth it.

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Maiyah78 Maiyah78
item.description:
@Maiyah78 wrote:

Sorry to necropost, but this is pretty high up there in the results for “swiftkit linux”, so I thought I’d add to this for Googlers:
The current stable release of SwiftKit has a Chrome rendering option. I believe Chrome runs in Wine, and I know it runs natively.
Also, as for the Mac thing, there is a basic emulator that was started sometime last year. It’s probably not mature enough yet to run Swiftkit. Here’s the Phoronix article: http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=MTI0Njc.

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:11, topic:431648”]Are you able to run mac based programs through something similar to WINE? Haven’t used Linux in a while so I wouldn’t be too sure, but I’d think there would be closer similarities between Mac executables and Linux shells than .exe’s.[/quote]I know nothing of macs sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

shells are now executables apparently - also, i don’t know of any suit that does that; why would you want it, though?

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Are you able to run mac based programs through something similar to WINE? Haven’t used Linux in a while so I wouldn’t be too sure, but I’d think there would be closer similarities between Mac executables and Linux shells than .exe’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:8, topic:431648”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=534354.msg3909532#msg3909532 date=1328571968]
It’s currently based off of Internet explorer.
[/quote]

And safari on mac.

what language is swiftkit even written in? if it’s c# it should be multiplatform.

It uses platform-based internet browsers for actually loading the game. So it doesn’t really matter what language it’s in.

sounds like the devs were(are) retarded

Not at all. They originally loaded it like bots do, using an applet stub and such. Jagex didn’t like that. As a result, they were forced to comply with this:

http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/Macroing%2C_and_third-party_software:

Software that can be used to gain an unfair advantage in our games may not be used. This includes automation tools, macros, bots, auto-typers and any other tools that circumvent any of our mechanisms designed to automatically log out inactive users.

Any game-specific, third-party software that encourages contradiction of the previous statement, bypasses the normal navigation of our website, automatically requests pages from our website or which endangers user accounts are also regarded as detrimental to RuneScape and should not be used.

This is also why Swiftkit now makes you start off at the home page to runescape.com, instead of directly linking to the applet page.[/quote]
I thought they simply navigated to that world’s page before.

Loveandpower:

I am still actively looking for a fix. If anybody can supply me with information would be great.

Could make your own?

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I am still actively looking for a fix. If anybody can supply me with information would be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Swiftkit on Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

rip4d:

It’s currently based off of Internet explorer.

And safari on mac.

[quote=“t4, post:6, topic:431648”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=534354.msg3909494#msg3909494 date=1328568632]

what language is swiftkit even written in? if it’s c# it should be multiplatform.

It uses platform-based internet browsers for actually loading the game. So it doesn’t really matter what language it’s in.
[/quote]
sounds like the devs were(are) retarded[/quote]

Not at all. They originally loaded it like bots do, using an applet stub and such. Jagex didn’t like that. As a result, they were forced to comply with this:

Software that can be used to gain an unfair advantage in our games may not be used. This includes automation tools, macros, bots, auto-typers and any other tools that circumvent any of our mechanisms designed to automatically log out inactive users.

Any game-specific, third-party software that encourages contradiction of the previous statement, bypasses the normal navigation of our website, automatically requests pages from our website or which endangers user accounts are also regarded as detrimental to RuneScape and should not be used.

This is also why Swiftkit now makes you start off at the home page to runescape.com, instead of directly linking to the applet page.

Read full topic

So let’s get started…
